verses.text: Then Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets and said to him, "Get ready, take this flask of oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-gilead.
verses.comment: Elisha delegates the anointing of Jehu.

verses.text: When you arrive there, look for Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat, son of Nimshi. Go in, make him get up from among his brothers, and lead him to an inner room.
verses.comment: The instructions are precise for privacy.

verses.text: Then take the flask of oil and pour it on his head, and say, 'Thus says the Lord: I anoint you king over Israel.' Then open the door and run; do not wait.
verses.comment: Follows the prophetic tradition begun with Saul, David.

verses.text: So the young man, the servant of the prophet, went to Ramoth-gilead.
When he arrived, he saw the commanders of the army sitting. He said, "Commander, I have a message for you." Jehu said, "For which one of us?" And he said, "For you, commander."
verses.comment: "Commander" translates 'commander of the army' for clarity.

verses.text: So Jehu got up and went inside. Then the young man poured oil on his head and said to him, "Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: I anoint you king over the people of the Lord, over Israel.
You shall strike down the house of Ahab your master, so that I may avenge the blood of my servants the prophets, and the blood of all the servants of the Lord, at the hand of Jezebel.
For the whole house of Ahab shall perish. I will cut off from Ahab every male in Israel, both bond and free.
verses.comment: The Hebrew is literally, 'everyone who urinates against the wall.' Paraphrased for modern clarity.

verses.text: I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha son of Ahijah.
And dogs shall eat Jezebel on the plot of ground at Jezreel, and there shall be no one to bury her." Then he opened the door and ran.
When Jehu went out to the servants of his master, they said to him, "Is all well? Why did this madman come to you?" He said to them, "You know the man and his talk."
But they said, "That's not true; tell us now." He said, "He said this to me: 'Thus says the Lord, I anoint you king over Israel.'"
Then each hurried and took his cloak and laid it under him on the bare steps. They blew the trumpet and proclaimed, "Jehu is king!"
verses.comment: 'Cloak on stairs' is ancient enthronement practice.

verses.text: So Jehu son of Jehoshaphat, son of Nimshi, conspired against Joram. (Now Joram with all Israel was defending Ramoth-gilead against Hazael king of Aram,

but King Joram had returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds which the Arameans had given him when he fought against Hazael king of Aram.) So Jehu said, "If this is your wish, let no one slip out of the city to go tell the news in Jezreel."
Then Jehu mounted his chariot and went to Jezreel, for Joram was lying there. And Ahaziah king of Judah had come down to visit Joram.

Now the watchman was standing on the tower in Jezreel, and he saw the company of Jehu as he came. He said, "I see a company." Joram said, "Take a horseman and send him to meet them, and let him ask, 'Is it peace?'"

So a horseman went to meet him and said, "The king asks, 'Is it peace?'" But Jehu said, "What do you have to do with peace? Fall in behind me." And the watchman reported, saying, "The messenger reached them, but he is not coming back."
verses.comment: 'Is it peace?' means 'Do you come in peace?'

verses.text: Then he sent out a second horseman who came to them and said, "The king asks, 'Is it peace?'" Jehu answered, "What do you have to do with peace? Fall in behind me."
Again the watchman reported, "He reached them but is not coming back. The driving is like the driving of Jehu son of Nimshi, for he drives furiously."

Joram said, "Get ready." And they got his chariot ready. Then Joram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah set out, each in his own chariot, and they went out to meet Jehu and found him on the field of Naboth the Jezreelite.
verses.comment: Field of Naboth is important for prophecy fulfillment.

verses.text: When Joram saw Jehu, he said, "Is it peace, Jehu?" He answered, "What peace can there be, as long as the harlotries and sorceries of your mother Jezebel are so many?"
Joram turned his hands and fled, and said to Ahaziah, "Treachery, Ahaziah!"
verses.comment: 'Turned his hands' means turned his horses to flee.

verses.text: Then Jehu drew his bow with full strength and shot Joram between his shoulders, so that the arrow pierced his heart, and he sank down in his chariot.

Jehu said to Bidkar his officer, "Pick him up and throw him on the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. For remember, when you and I rode together behind Ahab his father, the Lord pronounced this burden against him:

'As surely as I saw yesterday the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons, declares the Lord, I will pay you back on this plot of ground.' Now, therefore, take him and throw him on the plot of ground, according to the word of the Lord."
verses.comment: 'Blood of his sons'—an addition in the Hebrew text.

verses.text: But when Ahaziah king of Judah saw this, he fled by the road to Beth-haggan. And Jehu pursued him and said, "Shoot him also!" So they shot him in the chariot at the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. But he fled to Megiddo and died there.
verses.comment: 'Shoot him also!' is the Hebrew command.

verses.text: His servants carried him in a chariot to Jerusalem and buried him in his tomb with his fathers in the city of David.
In the eleventh year of Joram son of Ahab, Ahaziah began to reign over Judah.
When Jehu came to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it, and she painted her eyes, arranged her hair, and looked out of the window.
As Jehu entered the gate, she said, "Is it peace, Zimri, murderer of your master?"
verses.comment: 'Zimri'—Jezebel mocks Jehu by reference to the usurper Zimri.

verses.text: He lifted up his face to the window and said, "Who is on my side? Who?" Two or three eunuchs looked down at him.
He said, "Throw her down." So they threw her down, and some of her blood splattered on the wall and on the horses. And he trampled her underfoot.
Then he went in, ate and drank. And he said, "See now to this cursed woman and bury her, for she is a king’s daughter."
verses.comment: Jehu refers to royal status, not virtue.

verses.text: But when they went to bury her, they found no more of her than the skull and the feet and the palms of her hands.
When they came back and told him, he said, "This is the word of the Lord that he spoke by his servant Elijah the Tishbite: 'In the territory of Jezreel the dogs shall eat the flesh of Jezebel,
and the corpse of Jezebel shall be as dung on the surface of the field, in the territory of Jezreel, so that no one can say, ‘This is Jezebel.’"
verses.comment: So utterly destroyed, she is unrecognizable and denied burial.
